text: The day of fortune is like a harvest day, We must be busy when the corn is ripe.
author: Goethe

text: Night is the other half of life, and the better half.
author: Goethe

text: As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live.
author: Goethe

text: The dangers of life are infinite, and among them is safety.
author: Goethe

text: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough we must do.
author: Goethe

text: Whatever you can do, or dream you can, begin it. Boldness has genius, power and magic in it.
author: Goethe

text: The important thing in life is to have a great aim, and the determination to attain it.
author: Goethe

text: There is nothing more frightening than active ignorance.
author: Goethe

text: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
author: Goethe

text: Whatever you do, or dream you can, begin it. Boldness has genius and power and magic in it.
author: Goethe

text: The soul is indestructible and its activity will continue through eternity.
author: Goethe

text: Nothing is more dangerous for a new truth than an old misconception.
author: Goethe

text: Night's the better half of life.
author: Goethe

text: Whatever you can do, or dream you can do, begin it. Boldness has genius, power, and magic in it. Begin it now.
author: Goethe

text: Every situation— nay, every moment— is of infinite worth; for it is the representative of a whole eternity.
author: Goethe

text: It is easier to perceive error than to find truth, for the former lies on the surface and is easily seen, while the latter lies in the depth, where few are willing to search for it.
author: Goethe

text: Thinking is more interesting than knowing, but less interesting than looking.
author: Goethe

text: Austere perseverance, harsh and continuous, may be employed by the least of us and rarely fails of its purpose for its silent power grows irreversibly greater with time.
author: Goethe
